PARENTAL GUIDANCE.Definition: may contain content not suitable for children

PHENOMENON.Definition: something that exists and can be seen, felt, tasted, etc., especially something unusual or interesting

TRICKIER.Definition: if a piece of work or problem is tricky, it is difficult to deal with and needs careful attention or skill

PIONEERED.Definition: to be one of the first people to do something

ANTHROPOLOGIST.Definition: someone who scientifically studies humans and their customs, beliefs, and relationships

ESSENTIALLY.Definition: relating to the most important characteristics or ideas of something

SCAR.Definition: a sign of physical destruction in a place

VIRAL.Definition: used to describe something that quickly becomes very popular or well known by being published on the internet or sent from person to person by email, phone, etc.

GUERILLA.Definition: using unusual methods to create or get attention for your ideas, art, products, etc., usually ones that cost little money and involve using public spaces

ACTIVISTS.Definition: people who believe strongly in political or social change and take part in activities such as public protests to try to make this happen

COMMUTERS.Definition: someone who regularly travels between work and home

VALIDATED.Definition: to prove that something is correct

STRUCK A CHORD.Definition: If something strikes a chord, it causes people to approve of it or agree with it

RESONATED.Definition: if an experience or memory resonates, it makes you think of another similar one

EXTENSION.Definition: adding to something in order to make it bigger or longer

TAKES AIM AT.Definition: to criticize someone, especially in public

GOT RID OF.Definition: to remove or throw away something unwanted

PERNICIOUS.Definition: having a very harmful effect or influence

JUSTIFY.Definition: to give or to be a good reason for

OBLIGED.Definition: to force someone to do something, or to make it necessary for someone to do something

AGGRESSIVELY.Definition: in an angry and violent way

LOBBYISTS.Definition: someone who tries to persuade a politician or official group to do something

TELEMARKETERS.Definition: a person or company that sells a product or service by phone

CODE.Definition: a language used to program (= give instructions to) computers

PAPERWORK.Definition: the part of a job that involves writing letters and reports and keeping records

GESTURES.Definition: an action that expresses your feelings or intentions, although it might have little practical effect

PRODUCTIVITY.Definition: the rate at which a company or country makes goods, usually judged in connection with the number of people and the amount of materials necessary to produce the goods

PROFITABILITY.Definition: the amount of profit (money) generated by a company

INEFFICIENCIES.Definition: a lack of organization or skill that wastes time, energy, money, etc., or methods or actions that waste time, etc. in this way

SYSTEMATIC.Definition: relating to the way a system works

OBSESSED.Definition: unable to stop thinking about something; too interested in or worried about something

DEMONIZED.Definition: to try to make someone or a group of people seem as if they are evil

LOOK DOWN ON.Definition: to feel that someone is less important than you or does not deserve respect

DISPARAGE.Definition: to criticize someone or something in a way that shows you do not respect or value him, her, or it

INHERENTLY.Definition: in a way that exists as a natural or basic part of something

TANGIBLE.Definition: real and not imaginary; able to be shown, touched, or experienced

UNIVERSAL BASIC INCOME.Definition: the idea that every citizen would be given a set amount of money by the government, regardless of their financial situation

LOGIC.Definition: a particular way of thinking, especially one that is reasonable and based on good judgment

FIRSTHAND.Definition: if you experience something firsthand, you experience it yourself

HIT THE NAIL ON THE HEAD.Definition: to describe exactly what is causing a situation or problem

RECOUNT.Definition: to describe how something happened, or to tell a story

GUARDING.Definition: to be responsible for protecting someone or something, or for preventing someone from escaping

ENSURING.Definition: to make something certain to happen

SHARP.Definition: intelligent or quick to notice things

UNDIVIDED.Definition: existing as a whole not in separate parts

TWIDDLED MY THUMBS.Definition: to do nothing for a period of time, usually while you are waiting for something to happen

TEXTBOOK.Definition: (of an example of something) extremely good, or thought to be usual or typical

NULLIFIED.Definition: to make a legal agreement or decision have no legal force

ASSIGNED.Definition: to give a particular job or piece of work to someone

CONTRIBUTING.Definition: to give something, in order to provide or achieve something together with other people

DECORUM.Definition: behaviour that is socially correct, calm, and polite

MONOSPACED.Definition: (of a font) the letters or characters occupy the same space

ABSENT MINDED.Definition: Someone who is absent-minded often forgets things or does not pay attention to what is happening near them because they are thinking about other things.

DILIGENTLY.Definition: in a way that is careful and uses a lot of effort

RUBBER BAND.Definition: a thin ring of rubber used for holding things together

STAKEHOLDERS.Definition: a person such as an employee, customer, or citizen who is involved with an organization, society, etc. and therefore has responsibilities towards it and an interest in its success

UNADULTERATED.Definition: not spoiled or made weaker by the addition of other substances; pure

FORAY.Definition: a short period of time being involved in an activity that is different from and outside the range of a usual set of activities
